Name: Coptic textile
Description: A fragment of border in dark blue linen, with a geometric design of circles and stars which enclose lozenges, a cross and spirals etc. in indigo and white. The old border has been remounted on a new garment of coarse natural linen, hiding the seam.Technique: plain weave ground. Pattern inlaid in linen thread, one row of ground between each inlaid thread.Ends per inch (warp threads): 40.Picks per inch (weft threads): 28 over ground.
